title: Eden Hazard ruled out of Chelsea's clash with Stoke after suffering muscle injury during training
text:
Sport Eden Hazard ruled out of Chelsea's clash with Stoke after suffering muscle injury during training The Belgian has been struggling with a muscular injury and didn't travel with the rest of the squad on Friday night Share Hazard is out of the trip to Stoke (Photo: Getty) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chelsea will be without Eden Hazard for their clash with Stoke. 
The Belgian has been struggling with a muscular injury and didn't travel with the rest of the squad on Friday night. 
Antonio Conte admitted in his pre-match press conference that he had concerns over a couple of players for the trip to the Bet365 Stadium. 
And one of those doubts was Hazard, who has had an excellent season. 
The 26-year-old came in for some rough treatment from Manchester United during Monday's FA Cup win but it is believed he picked up the injury during training. Hazard in action against United (Photo: Rex Features) The Belgian is tripped by Paul Pogba (Photo: AFP) Valencia fouls Hazard (Photo: Rex Features) 
There had been doubts over Victor Moses but Conte confirmed he had trained and looks set to play. 
Pedro, who was a substitute for the clash with United, is expected to come in for Hazard. 
"Itâ€™s important to check a couple of situations and make the best decision tomorrow," Conte said on Friday.
